# UISnapBehavior

**Class**

A spring-like behavior whose initial motion is damped over time so that the object settles at a specific point.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class UISnapBehavior
```

## Overview

A **dynamic item** is any iOS or custom object that conforms to the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicItem] protocol. The [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView] and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UICollectionViewLayoutAttributes] classes implement this protocol starting in iOS 7.0. You can use a custom object as a dynamic item for such purposes as reacting to rotation or position changes computed by a dynamic animator—an instance of the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicAnimator] class.

To use a snap behavior with a dynamic item, perform these two steps:

1. Initialize a new snap behavior with the item using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISnapBehavior/init(item:snapTo:)] method
2. Enable the behavior by adding it to an animator using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicAnimator/addBehavior(_:)] method

The coordinate system that pertains to a snap behavior, and the types of dynamic items you can use with the behavior, depend on how you initialized the associated animator. For details, read the Overview of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicAnimator].

You can include a snap behavior in a custom, composite behavior by starting with a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicBehavior] object and adding a snap behavior with the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicBehavior/addChildBehavior(_:)] method.  If you want to influence a snap behavior at each step of a dynamic animation, implement the inherited [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicBehavior/action] method.

## Initializing a snap behavior

- **init(item:snapTo:)**: Initializes a snap behavior with a dynamic item and a snap point.

## Configuring a snap behavior

- **snapPoint**: The point to which to snap.
- **damping**: The amount of oscillation of a dynamic item during the conclusion of a snap.

## Behaviors

- **UIDynamicBehavior**: An object that confers a behavioral configuration on one or more dynamic items, for their participation in 2D animation.
- **UIAttachmentBehavior**: A relationship between two dynamic items, or between a dynamic item and an anchor point.
- **UICollisionBehavior**: An object that confers to a specified array of dynamic items the ability to engage in collisions with each other and with the behavior’s specified boundaries.
- **UIFieldBehavior**: An object that applies field-based physics to dynamic items.
- **UIGravityBehavior**: An object that applies a gravity-like force to all of its associated dynamic items.
- **UIPushBehavior**: A behavior that applies a continuous or instantaneous force to one or more dynamic items, causing those items to change position accordingly.

## Inherits From

- UIDynamicBehavior
